name: The Reach, A Waldorf Astoria Resort

reviews.text: Great location, the hotel was ok. not a Waldorf Astoria level so was expecting something a bit nicer. Small pool, only 1 restaurant and no other options for drinks or food/snacks. Pool table and activities right in midddle of restaurant and bar area with lots of area to expand so not sure why they crammed everything into a porch. The pool staff was great. DJ got us set up most everyday. Wait staff had to work pool/beach and restaurant did not make a lot of sense to do it that way. It resulted in a warm $15 mojito. You could always get a table at the restaurant so I think we were not alone in our assesment. Strip House "Easter" was good but the service made the evening spectacular,Luther was one of the best I have ever had he was oen of the highlights of the hotel. This property has lots of potential just missing some tlc.
reviews.title: Almost Paradise... Should have stayed at the Sister Resort Casa Marina

reviews.text: Traveled for Spring Break getaway with two adults and two teenagers...much to see and experience on Duvall Street. Hotel had a good beach and great pool. Walking distance to all Key West attractions...Hemingway House, Butterfly Conservatory even could walk to Mallory Square for sunset celebration. Taxi service reasonably priced when needed. Hotel concierge extremely helpful and friendly. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Great restaurants, right on the beach, 5 seconds to Duvall St!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my mom and boyfriend for Christmas 2008. The hotel was beautiful, service was great, and having a beach in Key West was definitely nice. I found a special online, the room rates advertised on the hotel website seem somewhat overpriced for this place. I'd definitely do some research before booking directly with the hotel as room rates seem to vary wildly.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with beach

reviews.text: Also, they may have changed the descriptions but I booked a suite thinking that it had a separate sleeping area. Luckily, they let me add a second room at the same rate. The rooms are more like studios so book two if you don't want to have everyone sleeping right next to each other.
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reach is a class act! The beach boy DJ is one awesome dude! He will attent to your every need! What a place to vacation! Thanx folks and a special thanx to DJ...
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel on quiet side of Key West

reviews.text: The best thing the hotel has going for it is the beach which is pretty rare in Key West. The rooms are average, the service is a bit below average. For instance, I stood around in the lobby with my bags for about 10 minutes before I was able to check in. There was only one other person in front of me but the desk agent was training someone. That's fine but when the door person or the bell hop or any of the other people walked by they might have asked if they could take my bag, did I need help, etc.
reviews.title: Only if you get a deal...

reviews.text: We booked on priceline so this hotel picked us more than we picked it. The location is at the quiet end of Duval St. The room was clean but could have been a little cleaner. The amenity fee is a bit of a rip off when it basically entitles you to some beach chairs and towels that you don't have to bring from your room. $15 a day tacked on for parking is also a bit over the top.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In sum, you know what they say about beggars and choosers. In that respect I can't really say anything bad but had I chosen this hotel on my own I would have been let down.
reviews.title: The hotel is a rip off for the money.

reviews.text: I have traveled for business for several years and found that the staff at the Reach Resort was outstanding, especially the beach and pool staff. D.J. and Julian went above and beyond to accomodate us. The front desk easily allow us a late check out, which was so nice.
reviews.title: Very nice but far from Duval St.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Key West twice in the past year and typically try new places when I travel for pleasure. I will be staying at the Reach during all of my trips to Key West from here forward.
reviews.title: Highly recommend a stay at The Reach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a mixed review on this resort. The location and overall appeal is perfect. Sitting on it's own corner of the Key West world, they have their own sand beach as well as a fantastic pool and lounging area. The hotel is that understated tropical style. Tile floors, cool colors, white trim. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. What we were put into was a converted ADA handicap suite. Unfortunately, there was furniture missing, and the place was pretty dirty. Not dust, but more like food stuck in the furniture dirty. We discussed the furniture issue with the front desk and they indicated that they would locate a dresser for the bedroom (there was only a bed and two nightstands in the room in order to accommodate a wheelchair). Nothing ever arrived, and no further response was ever received from management. :^( So our clothes were put in the living room, and also stacked up in the closet for our stay. . . I'm on vacation to relax, so I'm NOT going to stress over this. . .
reviews.title: Beautiful location . . . Service Needs to step up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did have a really nice large balcony overlooking the pool area and out to the ocean. It was totally relaxing to sit out and just people watch and also watch the ocean.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Reach is located at 'the opposite end from Mallory Square", but Key West is so small that you are only a couple blocks from all the main attractions of Duval Street. Right on the corner is a place to rent bikes and/or scooters for those that don't care for a short walk.
reviews.title: Location: paradise. Service: ordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would recommend The Reach Resort, and I would also stay there again. I did receive a letter of apology from the resort management after I had returned from vacation. A nice gesture, but why couldn't they rectify the issue while I was still there?
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: Reach Resort was great for just kicking back and relaxing. Hammocks on the palm trees, nice beach great pool and popcicles at 2PM. Also great being able to use sister resort. The $25.00 resort fee was not a problem, if that is what they want for free internet and a great friendly staff...no problem.
reviews.title: Solid hotel with quirky layout

reviews.text: Coming from Paris, France, I stayed there with my two kids (16 and 13) during one week in February 2010.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay, very nice and helpfull staff, direct beach
Bedbugs in a luxury resort
reviews.text: The room was decent, although not to the level we could be awaiting for a waldorf astoria hotel. However, my comment here may be tainted, since Iat 47, am an extensive traveller, and have personnally stayed in a lot of luxury hotels in the world, so yu have to take this into account. However, the room was clean, bathroom was large and well furnished, we had a very nice terrace overlooking the ocean, and the hotel, although full, was very quiet.
A nice heated pool, a well furnished gym. As well, nice rooftops where you could sip your wine with a outstanding view on the sunset.
reviews.title: Calling this even a three star hotel is a "REACH"

reviews.text: From the pool, you access directly to a little beach, and I think this might be the only hotel on the island offering this.
reviews.title: Relax with Reach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is just from walking distant of the main street, dining and activities, which was a blessing.
reviews.title: Overpriced - ridiculous extra charges

aka: The Reach, a Waldorf Astoria Hotel
description: Its $32 million renovation complete, Reach Resort is open for business! Emerging as the standard in Key West luxury, this boutique beauty has been completely redesigned and remodeled, but is still in the same great location.
